column1: #Text=Single crystals of YMnO3 were grown by the floating-zone technique.
#Text=The feed and seed rods for the crystal growth were prepared by solid-state reaction.
#Text=Stoichiometric mixtures of Y2O3 and Mn2O3 were ground together and calcined in air at 1100 °C for 24 h.
#Text=It was then reground again into a powder and pressed into a 6-mm-diameter 60-mm rod under 400 atm hydrostatic pressure, which were finally sintered at 1200 °C for 20 h.
#Text=The crystal growth was carried out in air in an IR-heated image furnace with a growth rate of 4 mm h−1.
#Text=Small pieces of the single crystals were ground into fine powder for XRD, which shows the pure phase of hexagonal YMnO3.
